intro: Vigna friesiorum, commonly known as the black gram or urad dal, is an annual leguminous plant native to South and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pod-like fruits that contain several dark-colored seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in warm, tropical climates with well-drained soil. Its seeds are rich in protein and are widely used in various cuisines, particularly in Indian and Middle Eastern cooking. Vigna friesiorum is also valued for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, improving soil fertility.
